title: Ticket #108: PrivSep: Switchboard's valid-caller-gids config knob too restrictive
description:
In order for a Condor daemon to be able to use the PrivSep Switchboard, it must satisfy two requirements based on the Switchboard's configuration.

  1. Condor's UID must be in the Switchboard's valid-caller-uids list
  2. All of Condor's GIDs must be in the Switchboard's valid-caller-gids list

It seems strange that when enabling a set of daemons to use the Switchboard you have to worry not only about what UID they will run as, but also all the GIDs they will use as well. Further, the set of GIDs may change over time, which can cause Condor to stop working in the Switchboard's configuration is properly kept in sync.
